{{Use mdy dates|date=November 2018}} {{Not confuse|Church of Satan}} {{Infobox religion |name = The Satanic Temple |image = [[Image:TSTredlogo.jpg|180px]] |abbreviation = TST |type = Satanic [[religion]], [[social movement]], [[advocacy group]], [[Protest|protest group]] |founder = Malcolm Jarry, [[Lucien Greaves]] |founded_date = 2012 |leader_title = Spokesperson |leader_name = [[Lucien Greaves]] |headquarters = [[Salem, Massachusetts]] |membership = |region = International |methods = [[Activism]], [[protest]], [[lobbying]] |website = {{official URL}} |footnotes = }}
'''The Satanic Temple''' is a [[nontheistic religion|nontheistic religious]] and [[activism|political activist]] group based in [[Salem, Massachusetts]].<ref name="KansasCity1">{{cite news |url=https://www.kansascity.com/news/local/article173168316.html |title=Satanists emerge as advocate as Planned Parenthood restores Missouri abortion services |newspaper=[[Kansas City Star|The Kansas City Star]] |first=Lisa |last=Gutierrez |date=September 13, 2017 |access-date=November 29, 2018}}</ref><ref name="NewReligMove">{{cite book |title=The Oxford Handbook of New Religious Movements, Volume 2 |first1=James R. |last1=Lewis |first2=Inga B. |last2=Tollefsen |publisher=[[Oxford University Press]] |year=2016 |pages=441-453}}</ref><ref name="Esquire1"/><ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.masslive.com/news/index.ssf/2016/09/satanic_temple_to_open_first_h.html |title=Satanic Temple to open first headquarters in Salem, host art gallery, lectures, possibly weddings |work=MassLive |date=September 14, 2016 |access-date=November 29, 2018}}</ref> The Temple has several chapter groups, the largest of which is in [[Detroit|Detroit, Michigan]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Why Detroit Has the Largest Satanist Temple Chapter in the US |url=https://abcnews.go.com/US/detroit-largest-satanist-temple-chapter-us/story?id=32714083 |first=Susanna |last=Kim |work=[[ABC News]] |date=July 28, 2015 |access-date=November 29, 2018}}</ref> The group uses Satanic imagery to promote [[egalitarianism]], [[social justice]], and the [[separation of church and state]]. Their stated mission is "to encourage [[altruism|benevolence]] and [[compassion|empathy]] among all people". The group was co-founded by [[Lucien Greaves]], the organization's spokesperson, and Malcolm Jarry.<ref name="NYT1">{{cite news |title=A Mischievous Thorn in the Side of Conservative Christianity |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2015/07/11/us/a-mischievious-thorn-in-the-side-of-conservative-christianity.html |newspaper=[[The New York Times]] |date=July 10, 2015 |access-date=November 29, 2018 |issn=0362-4331 |first=Mark |last=Oppenheimer}}</ref> The Satanic Temple has utilized [[religious satire|satire]], theatrical ploys, humor, and direct legal action in their public campaigns to generate attention and prompt people to reevaluate fears and perceptions, and to highlight religious hypocrisy and encroachment on [[religious freedom]].<ref name="Trolling">{{cite web |title=Trolling Hell: Is the Satanic Temple a Prank, the Start of a New Religious Movement — or Both? |url=https://www.villagevoice.com/2014/07/22/trolling-hell-is-the-satanic-temple-a-prank-the-start-of-a-new-religious-movement-or-both/ |first=Anna |last=Merlan |work=[[Village Voice]] |date=July 22, 2014 |access-date=November 29, 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |title=The Satanic Temple's giant statue of a goat-headed god is looking for a home |url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/acts-of-faith/wp/2015/07/01/the-satanic-temples-giant-statue-of-a-goat-headed-god-is-looking-for-a-home/?noredirect=on |newspaper=[[The Washington Post]] |date=July 1, 2015 |access-date=November 29, 2018 |issn=0190-8286 |first=Abby |last=Ohlheiser}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |title=The Satanic Temple Is Suing Missouri Over Its Abortion Law |url=https://news.vice.com/en_us/article/7xa959/the-satanic-temple-is-suing-missouri-over-its-abortion-law |website=[[Vice.com]] |first=Avi |last=Asher-Shapiro |access-date=November 29, 2018 |date=June 24, 2015}}</ref>
The organization actively participates in public affairs that have manifested in several public political actions and efforts at [[lobbying]],<ref>{{cite web |first=Massoud |last=Hayoun |url=http://america.aljazeera.com/articles/2013/12/8/satanists-aim-tobuildamonumentonthebiblebelt.html |title=Group aims to put Satanist monument near Oklahoma capitol |publisher=[[Al Jazeera America]] |date=December 8, 2013 |access-date=November 29, 2018}}</ref><ref name="greaves">{{cite web |url=https://www.vice.com/en_us/article/4w7adn/unmasking-lucien-greaves-aka-doug-mesner-leader-of-the-satanic-temple |title=Unmasking Lucien Greaves, Leader of the Satanic Temple |last=Bugbee |first=Shane |publisher=[[Vice.com]] |date=July 30, 2013 |access-date=November 29, 2018}}</ref> with a focus on the separation of church and state and using satire against [[Christian privilege]] that it says interferes with personal religious freedom. It considers [[marriage]] a religious sacrament that should be governed under the First Amendment's protection of religious liberty, and which should prevail over state laws.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://friendlyatheist.patheos.com/2016/01/13/when-it-comes-to-the-satanic-temple-christians-seem-to-love-bearing-false-witness/ |title=When It Comes to The Satanic Temple, Christians Seem to Love Bearing False Witness |first=Hemant |last=Mehta |publisher=[[Patheos]] |date=January 13, 2016 |access-date=November 29, 2018}}</ref> Because the group regards [[bodily integrity|inviolability of the body]] as a key doctrine, it also views all restrictions on [[abortion]], including [[Types of abortion restrictions in the United States#Waiting periods|mandatory waiting periods]], as an infringement on the rights of Satanists to practice their religion.<ref name="abortion">{{cite web |url=https://www.salon.com/2015/05/01/satanist_challenges_missouris_72_hour_abortion_wait_its_a_burden_on_my_sincerely_held_religious_beliefs/ |title=Satanist challenges Missouri's 72-hour abortion wait: It's "a burden on my sincerely held religious beliefs" |date=May 1, 2015 |publisher=[[Salon (website)|Salon]] |last=Kutner |first=Jenny |access-date=November 29, 2018}}</ref> The Satanic Temple does not believe in a supernatural [[Satan]]. The Temple uses the [[Devil in popular culture#Literature|literary Satan]] as a metaphor to promote pragmatic [[skepticism]], rational reciprocity, personal autonomy, and curiosity.<ref name="NYT1"/> Satan is thus used as a symbol representing "the eternal rebel" against arbitrary authority and social norms.<ref name="FAQ">{{cite web |title=FAQ |url=https://thesatanictemple.com/pages/faq |website=The Satanic Temple |access-date=November 29, 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |title=What does Satan mean to the Satanic Temple? |url=https://www.cnn.com/videos/tv/2015/11/30/satanic-temple-lisa-ling-orig.cnn |website=CNN |date=November 30, 2015 |access-date=November 29, 2018}}</ref>
==History==
In an interview with ''[[The New York Times]]'', co-founder Malcolm Jarry stated that the idea of starting a Satanic [[faith-based organization]] was first conceived as one "that met all the [[Presidency of George W. Bush|Bush administration]]'s criteria for receiving funds, but was repugnant to them". The idea was inspired by then–president [[George W. Bush]]'s formation of [[White House Office of Faith-Based and Neighborhood Partnerships]], for which he thought something should be done to counter it.<ref name="NYT1"/> The Satanic Temple was founded in 2012, and began public demonstrations in 2013.<ref name="MSNBC1">{{cite web |title=Bashir: Satanists hail Florida Gov. Rick Scott |url=https://www.msnbc.com/martin-bashir/watch/bashir-satanists-hail-florida-gov-rick-scott-14650947887 |website=[[MSNBC]] |date=January 14, 2013 |access-date=November 29, 2018}}</ref><ref name="NYT1"/><ref name="Esquire1"/>
==Mission== The Satanic Temple describes its mission as follows: {{quote|The mission of The Satanic Temple is to encourage benevolence and empathy among all people, reject tyrannical authority, advocate practical common sense and justice, and be directed by the human conscience to undertake noble pursuits guided by the individual will. Politically aware, Civic-minded Satanists and allies in The Satanic Temple have publicly opposed The [[Westboro Baptist Church]], advocated on behalf of children in public school to abolish [[corporal punishment]], applied for equal representation where religious monuments are placed on public property, provided religious exemption and legal protection against laws that unscientifically restrict women's reproductive autonomy, exposed fraudulent harmful pseudo-scientific practitioners and claims in mental health care, and applied to hold clubs along side other religious after school clubs in schools besieged by [[proselytizing]] organizations.<ref>{{cite web |title=About Us |url=https://thesatanictemple.com/pages/about-us |website=The Satanic Temple |access-date=November 29, 2018}}</ref>}}
===Tenets=== The Satanic Temple has seven fundamental tenets: {{quote| # One should strive to act with compassion and empathy towards all creatures in accordance with reason. # The struggle for justice is an ongoing and necessary pursuit that should prevail over laws and institutions. # One's body is inviolable, subject to one's own will alone. # The freedoms of others should be respected, including the freedom to offend. To willfully and unjustly encroach upon the freedoms of another is to forgo your own. # Beliefs should conform to our best scientific understanding of the world. We should take care never to distort scientific facts to fit our beliefs. # People are fallible. If we make a mistake, we should do our best to rectify it and resolve any harm that may have been caused. # Every tenet is a guiding principle designed to inspire nobility in action and thought. The spirit of compassion, wisdom, and justice should always prevail over the written or spoken word.<ref>{{cite web |title=Tenets |url=https://thesatanictemple.com/pages/tenets |website=The Satanic Temple |access-date=November 29, 2018}}</ref>}}
Valerie Tarico of [[Salon (website)|''Salon'']] wrote that the tenets were egalitarian and "truer to the words of [[Jesus]] than most Christians," referring to the tenets as expressing the primacy of compassion and empathy and conducive to a path to [[equanimity]].<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.salon.com/2015/11/28/the_greatest_trick_the_satanists_ever_pulled_they_may_be_truer_to_the_words_of_jesus_than_most_christians_partner/ |title=The greatest trick the satanists ever pulled: They may be truer to the words of Jesus than most Christians |first=Valerie |last=Tarico |website=Salon |date=November 28, 2015 |access-date=November 29, 2018}}</ref> This sentiment was echoed in an article for ''[[Patheos]],'' wherein editor Michael Stone called the tenets "morality superior to [the] [[Ten Commandments]]," referring to them as "a more moral, and more optimistic stance, emphasizing positive, pro-social values."<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.patheos.com/blogs/progressivesecularhumanist/2016/01/satanic-temples-seven-tenants-are-morally-superior-to-ten-commandments/ |title=Satanic Temple's Seven Tenets Are Morally Superior To Ten Commandments |date=January 22, 2016 |website=Patheos.com |first=Michael |last=Stone |access-date=November 29, 2018}}</ref>
==Campaigns== [[File:LucienGreavesSASHAcon2016.jpg|thumb|right|200px|[[Lucien Greaves]], spokesperson for The Satanic Temple, at SASHAcon, March 2016]] Individual chapters hold gatherings with rituals and activities designed to highlight and push back against the right-wing religious establishment and archaic traditions and norms. For example, one group in Detroit held a gathering that included [[dance music]], a porn room, "surprisingly good hors d'oeuvres", and "a statue that's either a penis and testicles or a woman gazing into a mirror, depending on your point of view", and a wine ceremony involving three naked participants.<ref name="dailybeast">{{cite web |url=https://www.thedailybeast.com/can-the-satanic-temple-save-america |title=Can the Satanic Temple Save America? |date=February 17, 2015 |access-date=November 29, 2018 |publisher=[[The Daily Beast]] |last=Kaffer |first=Nancy}}</ref> The Satanic Temple has taken part in several public activities that have been the focus of public scrutiny.
===Grey Faction=== The Grey Faction is a project of The Satanic Temple with the goal of exposing malpractice and pseudoscience associated with [[Satanic ritual abuse]] conspiracy theories. The Grey Faction protests medical conferences, initiates legal action, and petitions medical boards. The faction has protested conferences held by the [[International Society for the Study of Trauma and Dissociation]], which advocates for the discredited practice of [[recovered-memory therapy]].<ref>{{cite news |last=Harris |first=Malcolm |title=Satan Has No Interest in Molesting Your Kids |url=https://psmag.com/news/satan-has-no-interest-in-molesting-your-kids |access-date=November 29, 2018 |work=Pacific Standard |date=October 25, 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |last=Nguyen |first=Gary |title=How Science Created A Panic About Satanic Cults |url=https://www.worldreligionnews.com/religion-news/science-created-panic-satanic-cults |access-date=November 29, 2018 |work=World Religion News |date=March 27, 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |last=Laycock |first=Joseph |title=Satanic Temple Protests Pseudoscientific Therapies for Satanic Abuse and Witchcraft |url=http://religiondispatches.org/satanic-temple-protests-pseudoscientific-therapies-for-satanic-abuse-and-witchcraft/ |access-date=November 29, 2018 |work=Religion Dispatches |date=April 6, 2016}}</ref> The group has also petitioned for investigation into the killing by Gigi Jordan of her child, which was connected to the discredited practice of [[facilitated communication]].<ref>{{cite news |last=Saint Thomas |first=Sophie |title=Satanists Call for Investigation into 'Satanic Panic' Killing of 8-Year-Old Boy |url=https://broadly.vice.com/en_us/article/d7am3a/satanists-call-for-investigation-into-satanic-panic-killing-of-8-year-old-boy |access-date=November 29, 2018 |work=Broadly |date=February 17, 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |last=Shewan |first=Dan |title=Conviction of Things Not Seen: The Uniquely American Myth of Satanic Cults |url=https://psmag.com/social-justice/make-a-cross-with-your-fingers-its-the-satanic-panic |access-date=November 29, 2018 |work=Pacific Standard |date=September 8, 2015}}</ref>
===Prayer in schools=== The organization first gained media attention in January 2013 after a group of Satanists assembled at the [[Florida State Capitol]] to show their approval over a bill [[Rick Scott|Governor Rick Scott]] signed into law the prior year, Senate Bill 98, which allowed student-led prayer at school assemblies.<ref name="Trolling" /> The group further stated that as the bill did not specify a religion, the prayers could be led by a student from any religion—including Satanism. The TST members announced they "were coming out to say how happy we were because now our Satanic children could pray to Satan in school."<ref name="MSNBC1"/><ref name="NYT1"/><ref name="Esquire1"/>
===“Adopt-a-highway” campaign=== One of the projects launched by The Satanic Temple was an attempt to raise enough money to "adopt-a-highway" in New York City. The adopt-a-highway program would have involved the group to maintain and beautify part of the public highway for up to two years. Their goal was to raise awareness about religious diversity. The group stated that “The campaign will do more than keep our highways clean. It will help send a clear message to the world reaffirming American Religious Plurality”. The group raised just over $2,000 between June 10 and August 15, 2013; short of their goal of $15,000. If their goal had been reached, the [[New York State Department of Transportation|New York Department of Transportation]] would have approved the plan, and the funds would have been put toward the campaign. In the event that the department did not approve the project, the funds were to support contesting that decision. The organization offered different incentive levels for donations, ranging from ten dollars, for which the donor would receive a button, to ten thousand dollars, for which the donor would receive a full “Membership Package,” including the ability to choose the location of and to participate in the next Pink Mass that The Satanic Temple performed.

===Protect Children Project=== The Protect Children Project is an initiative launched by The Satanic Temple in the spring of 2014. The project's aims are stated to offer "[[First Amendment]] protection to support children who may be at risk for being subjected to mental or physical abuse in school by teachers and administrators through the use of [[solitary confinement]], restraints, and corporal punishment."<ref>{{cite web |title=Protect Children Project |url=https://protectchildrenproject.com/ |access-date=November 29, 2018}}</ref> The Protect Children Project's website asked participants to print out pre-written letters to send to their respective school boards on a day designated as "Protect Children Day" as a form of protest.<ref>{{cite web |title=The Satanic Temple, Now Wooing Kids and Moms |url=https://www.vocativ.com/culture/religion/satanic-temple-now-wooing-kids-moms/ |website=[[Vocativ]] |access-date=November 29, 2018 |first=Emily |last=Levy |date=May 6, 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |title=Satanic Temple launches school campaign to "protect" children and permit them to pray to Satan |first=Brownie |last=Marie |date=April 11, 2014 |url=https://www.christiantoday.com/article/satanic-temple-launches-school-campaign-protect-children-permit-pray-satan/36749.htm |website=[[Christian Today]] |access-date=November 29, 2018}}</ref> In March 2017, The Satanic Temple launched an anti-spanking campaign against corporal punishment in schools, as part of the Protect Children Project. They unveiled billboards in Texas which read ''"Never be hit in school again. Exercise your religious rights."''<ref>{{cite news |title=Satanic Temple launches school anti-spanking campaign in Texas (PHOTO, VIDEO) |url=https://www.rt.com/usa/381318-satanic-temple-spanking-schools/ |access-date=November 29, 2018 |date=March 19, 2017 |work=RT International |agency=Russia Today |language=en-EN}}</ref>
===Planned Parenthood protests=== On August 22, 2015 the Detroit chapter of The Satanic Temple held a [[counter-protest]] outside of a [[Ferndale, Michigan|Ferndale]] [[Planned Parenthood]] location in response to anti-abortionist groups that were planning to protest Planned Parenthood on that same date.<ref>{{cite web |title=The Satanic Temple countered Planned Parenthood protests with some guerrilla theatre |url=https://www.metrotimes.com/news-hits/archives/2015/08/24/the-satanic-temple-countered-the-planned-parenthood-national-day-of-protest-with-some-guerrilla-theatre |website=[[Detroit Metro Times]] |access-date=November 29, 2018 |date=August 24, 2015 |first=Lee |last=DeVito}}</ref> As part of the protest the Temple held a [[guerrilla theatre]] performance that included two men dressed as clergy pouring milk on kneeling actresses.<ref>{{cite web |title=Satanists drench women with milk for Planned Parenthood counter-protest |url=https://www.washingtonexaminer.com/satanists-drench-women-with-milk-for-planned-parenthood-counter-protest |website=[[Washington Examiner]] |first=Barbara |last=Boland |access-date=November 29, 2018 |date=August 23, 2015}}</ref> This was not the first protest of this type that the Temple had held in support of the organization, as they had previously held a 2013 protest where they brought children to the [[Texas State Capitol]] who chanted "Fuck You" and "Hail Satan", while holding signs reading "Stay Out Of My Mommy's Vagina".<ref>{{cite web |title=Planned Parenthood Supporters: Satanists Drench Women in 'Breast' Milk To Stand Against 'Forced Motherhood' (VIDEO) |url=http://www.hngn.com/articles/123118/20150826/planned-parenthood-satanists-drench-women-breast-milk-stand-against-forced.htm |website=Headlines & Global News |date=August 26, 2015 |access-date=November 29, 2018}}</ref>
On April 23, 2016, members of the Detroit chapter of the Temple counter protested the Citizens for a Pro-Life Society's protest of Planned Parenthood. Temple members dressed in bondage [[fetish clothing]], wearing baby masks and diapers while engaging in [[flagellation]]. The Temple said that the reason for the protest was to "expose the anti-choice protest as an act of fetal [[idolatry]], highlighting the fetishization and abstraction of the 'baby.'"<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.metrotimes.com/news-hits/archives/2016/04/23/the-satanic-temple-plans-to-interrupt-some-planned-parenthood-in-classic-satanic-temple-fashion |title=The Satanic Temple will interrupt Planned Parenthood protests in classic Satanic Temple fashion |first=Alysa |last=Zavala-Offman |website=Detroit Metro Times |date=April 23, 2016 |access-date=November 29, 2018}}</ref>

=== After School Satan === {{Main article|After School Satan}}
After School Satan is an [[After-school activity|after school program]] sponsored by The Satanic Temple. It was created in July 2016 as an alternative to the [[Christian]]-based after school group called the [[Good News Club]].<ref name="AfterSchoolSatan">{{cite web |title=FAQ |url=https://afterschoolsatan.com/educatin-with-satan/faq/ |website=After School Satan |access-date=November 29, 2018}}</ref><ref name="latimes1">{{cite web |last=Anderson |first=Rick |title=Yes, an after-school Satan Club could be coming to your kid's grade school |url=https://www.latimes.com/nation/la-na-satanic-after-school-20160928-snap-story.html |date=September 28, 2016 |website=LA Times |access-date=November 29, 2018}}</ref><ref name="cbs-port">{{cite web |title=Portland OKs "After School Satan" for elementary kids |url=https://www.cbsnews.com/news/after-school-satan-satanic-temple-portland-approved/ |website=CBS News |date=September 28, 2016 |access-date=November 29, 2018}}</ref>
=== Los Angeles Satanic Mass === On January 14, 2017, a week before the Trump presidential inauguration, the Temple hosted what it billed as the largest Satanic gathering in history, hoping to double the attendance of the 2015 gathering in Detroit for the Baphomet unveiling. Film crews from VICE and NatGeo were on hand to document the event. The mass included three parts: Invocation Ritual, Destruction Ritual and a Bloodletting Ritual.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.facebook.com/events/1829019433995074/ |title=Satanic Mass ft. 3teeth, Author & Punisher, Coven of Ashes |website=Facebook |date=January 14, 2017 |access-date=November 29, 2018}}</ref> Local Los Angeles media was also on hand to cover the event, calling the event "a bloody good time".<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.laweekly.com/slideshow/the-satanic-temples-black-mass-was-a-bloody-good-time-7826667 |title=The Satanic Black Mass was a Bloody Good Time |website=LA Weekly |date=January 13, 2017 |access-date=November 29, 2018}}</ref>
==Membership== Membership in The Satanic Temple is free and open to anyone and can be obtained by signing up on the official website.<ref name="Join Us">{{cite web |title=Join Us |url=https://thesatanictemple.com/pages/join-us |website=The Satanic Temple |access-date=November 29, 2018}}</ref> Membership cards can be purchased for $25. Additionally, members can apply to join local chapters, though according to Draco Ignis and Hofman A Turing, members of the NYC chapter, the requirements for each chapter may differ. "If there's a local chapter where you are, to join you do have to be accepted, but there's no initiation or anything. You don't even have to be a Satanist, you can just be a strong ally who believes in the political and secular actions without being super stoked about all the aesthetic aspects."<ref>{{cite web |title=The Satanic Temple of NYC is Fighting For Your Liberty and Your Uterus |url=https://brokeassstuart.com/2016/11/22/103831/ |website=Broke Ass Stuart |date=November 22, 2016 |access-date=November 29, 2018}}</ref> Membership is subject to renewal, revocation, or termination "for a member's failure to conduct him or herself in a manner consistent with the spirit of The Satanic Temple and its tenets."<ref name="Join Us" />
==Chapters== The Temple has chapters across the United States, with the largest group in Detroit, Michigan.
In September 2014, Jex Blackmore launched a chapter of The Satanic Temple in Detroit, Michigan.<ref>{{cite web |title=Satanic Temple launches Detroit chapter; same-sex wedding ceremonies, location in city part of plans |date=September 6, 2014 |first=Eric |last=Lacy |url=https://www.mlive.com/news/detroit/index.ssf/2014/09/satanic_temple_launches_detroi.html |website=[[MLive.com]] |access-date=November 29, 2018}}</ref> She held a membership and information booth at the community festival [[Dally in the Alley]], where she reported that she received good support and turnout.<ref name="JexBlackmore">{{cite web |title=Q&A: Satanic Temple of Detroit's Jex Blackmore explains group's purpose, growth potential |url=https://www.mlive.com/news/detroit/index.ssf/2015/02/qa_satanic_temple_of_detroits.html |date=February 19, 2015 |website=MLive.com |access-date=November 29, 2018}}</ref> On December 21 of that same year the chapter constructed a holiday display for "Snaketivity" on the lawn of the [[Michigan State Capitol]] as a way to counteract and protest a [[nativity scene]] that was placed on the state grounds only days earlier.<ref name="Snaketivity">{{cite web |title='Snaketivity' display set up at Michigan Capitol draws supporters, opponents |url=https://www.mlive.com/lansing-news/index.ssf/2014/12/snaketivity_on_display_at_mich.html |website=MLive.com |date=December 21, 2014 |access-date=November 29, 2018}}</ref> The holiday display depicted a snake, a [[pentagram]], a book, and a cross with the words "Knowledge is the Greatest Gift of All" prominently displayed.<ref name="Snaketivity" /> In 2015 the chapter commented that they were interested in re-erecting the Snaketivity display or a similar live display after learning that United States Senator [[Ted Cruz]] planned to host a live nativity scene at the Capitol on December 19.<ref>{{cite web |title=Satanic Temple to counter Ted Cruz nativity in Lansing |url=https://www.freep.com/story/news/local/michigan/2015/12/02/cruz-campaigns-nativity-lansing-spurs-snaketivity/76661818/ |website=Detroit Free Press |date=December 2, 2015 |first=Justin A. |last=Hinkley |access-date=November 29, 2018}}</ref>
Blackmore has stated that the chapter has a core group of about 15 to 20 followers, depending on the project, and that "there's another group, depending on the activity or what we're doing, that's about one tier larger -- probably about 50 or more."<ref name="JexBlackmore" /> The chapter does not have a physical office or building and operates primarily out of rented or borrowed spaces along with other locations.<ref name="JexBlackmore" />
In a statement posted to her Twitter account in February 2018, Blackmore stated that she has stepped down from her role as spokesperson and chapter head to focus on her personal artistic endeavors.{{cite tweet |user=JexBlackmore |number=965704440211804160 |date=February 19, 2018 |title=Announcement! |access-date=November 29, 2018}} In August 2018, Blackmore amended her statement with an editorial on Medium claiming her resignation was not voluntary and made claims of long term gender, sexual, and racial diversity problems within the organization as well as claims of being harassed personally.<ref>{{cite web |title=The Struggle for Justice is Ongoing: On my departure from The Satanic Temple |url=https://medium.com/@JexBlackmore/the-struggle-for-justice-is-ongoing-6df38f8893db |first=Jex |last=Blackmore |website=Medium |access-date=November 29, 2018 |date=August 6, 2018}}</ref> Following Blackmore's statement, other members resigned citing similar complaints <ref>{{cite web |title=The Satanic Temple In Engulfed In A Civil War |first=Anna |last=Merlan |url=https://jezebel.com/the-satanic-temple-is-engulfed-in-a-civil-war-over-a-de-1828130997 |website=Jezebel |date=August 7, 2018 |access-date=November 29, 2018}}</ref> including the entire [[Los Angeles|Los Angeles, California]] chapter which rebranded as "The Satanic Collective"<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.instagram.com/p/BmFaw1WFO5i/ |website=Instagram |title=Please read our statement. Thank you for all of your support and we’ll see you soon. ♥️- TST LA |date=August 5, 2018 |access-date=November 29, 2018}}</ref> and all of the European chapters which rebranded as "Satanic Temple International".<ref>{{cite web |title=Statement from Satanic Temple International |url=https://www.facebook.com/satanictempleinternational/photos/a.245362315922620.1073741831.165781457214040/515715142220668/?type=3&theater |date=August 3, 2018 |website=Facebook |access-date=November 29, 2018}}</ref>
==Comparison to LaVeyan Satanism== Lucien Greaves has described the Temple as being a progressive and updated version of [[LaVeyan Satanism|LaVey's Satanism]].{{sfn|The Invention of Satanism|Dyrendal, Lewis, Petersen|2016|page=220}} The Temple sees itself as separate and distinct from LaVeyan Satanists, and feels that its principles and tenets represent "a natural evolution in Satanic thought". Greaves has said that the elements of [[Social Darwinism]] and [[Nietzscheanism]] within LaVeyan Satanism is incongruent with [[game theory]], [[reciprocal altruism]], and [[cognitive science]].<ref>{{cite AV media |url=https://davidpakman.com/interviews/douglas-mesner/ |title=Satanic Temple Founder Talks Atheistic Religion |work=[[The David Pakman Show]] |date=October 9, 2014 |access-date=November 29, 2018}}</ref> He has also criticized the [[Church of Satan]] for its lack of [[political lobbying]] and what he sees as their exclusivity, referring to them as [[autocratic]] and [[hierarchical]], and saying that the Church fetishizes [[authoritarianism]].<ref name="greaves"/><ref name="AfterSchoolSatan" /> Conversely, the Church of Satan has made statements claiming that The Satanic Temple are only "masquerading as Satanists<ref name="COS1">{{cite news |title=Third Side Intelligence: Missouri Abortions |url=https://www.churchofsatan.com/third-side-intelligence-missouri-abortions-the/ |date=October 10, 2017 |access-date=November 29, 2018}}</ref> and do not represent Satanism.<ref name="COS2">{{cite web |first=Reverend Joel |last=Ethan |title=The Satanic Temple Fact Sheet |url=https://www.churchofsatan.com/the-satanic-temple-fact-sheet/ |access-date=November 29, 2018}}</ref>
==Reception== The Satanic Temple has received criticism for their actions, most notably from religious organizations and figures.<ref>{{cite web |title=Satanic Temple Group Raising Money for On-Demand Abortions Echos Satanist History of 'Child Sacrifice,' Says Theologian |first=Stoyan |last=Zaimov |url=https://www.christianpost.com/news/satanic-temple-group-raising-money-for-on-demand-abortions-echoes-satanist-history-of-child-sacrifice-says-theologian-142087/ |website=[[Christian Post]] |date=July 30, 2015 |access-date=November 29, 2018}}</ref> Many critics state that they believe that the Temple is not a serious organization and is instead meant to be a prank, form of satire, or elaborate [[trolling]] attempt. Greaves and Blackmore have both dismissed these claims, as Greaves stated in a 2013 interview with ''[[Vice (magazine)|Vice]]'' that the Temple could be both satanic and satirical.<ref name="greaves"/> Blackmore has also stated that people believe that they are only "trying to cause trouble for no reason except to just be shocking", but the Temple says they are "adding to the dialogue that's already there and asking for rights -- just like anyone else."<ref name="JexBlackmore" />
Both Greaves and Blackmore have stated that they have received [[death threat|death threats]] in response to their activities with The Satanic Temple.<ref name="JexBlackmore" /><ref>{{cite web |title=Lucien Greaves of the Satanic Temple |url=https://www.metrotimes.com/detroit/lucien-greaves-of-the-satanic-temple/Content?oid=2201492 |website=[[Detroit Metro Times]] |date=May 27, 2014 |access-date=November 29, 2018}}</ref>

The '''Union of Welsh Independents''' ({{lang-cy|Undeb yr Annibynwyr Cymraeg}}) is a [[Reformed]] [[congregationalist]] denomination in [[Wales]].
== History == Welsh congregational churches or Independents stand in the [[Puritan]] tradition. The first congregational congregation was founded at [[Llanfaches]] in 1639. Early founders were in the puritan tradition. Later several churches were founded and formed separate denominations. They embraced different theological positions. Finally the denomination was founded in 1872 as a voluntary association of churches. They called it Independent because each congregation claims to be under the authority of [[Christ]]. Individual congregations cooperate through associations. Now the Union works through six departments: finance, [[Mission (Christianity)|mission]], [[Christian ministry|ministry]], education, churches, communication. The Union churches have much in common with other free churches in Wales. Ministers can freely move their ministry among them. The Unions council met once a year. ''The Union is a free and voluntary body, its aims to help to make churches a fellowship that serve Jesus Christ''.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.oikoumene.org/en/member-churches/union-of-welsh-independents|title=Union of Welsh Independents — World Council of Churches|website=www.oikoumene.org}}</ref> The church has high emphasis on preaching the [[Gospel]], and education, empowering church members. The denomination currently is working on a new mission strategy, the AGAPE program, started in 2005. The latest strategy is the Welsh Independents Development Program.<ref name="auto">[http://www.cwmeurope.org/en/about-cwm-europe/union-of-welsh-independents www.cwmeurope.org/en/about-cwm-europe/union-of-welsh-independents] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140831072751/http://www.cwmeurope.org/en/about-cwm-europe/union-of-welsh-independents |date=August 31, 2014 }}</ref>
== Statistics == In 2004 it had 12 associations of churches and 500 congregations and 34,884 member.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.reformiert-online.net/adressen/detail.php?id=1470&lg=eng|title=Address data base of Reformed churches and institutions|first=Christoph|last=Fasse|website=www.reformiert-online.net}}</ref> Now it has 450 churches, 31,000 members and 16 associations and about 107 ministers in 2006. The worship service are primary in [[Welsh language]].<ref>[http://www.annibynwyr.org/aboutus/index.html www.annibynwyr.org/aboutus/index.html] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20131013042718/http://www.annibynwyr.org/aboutus/index.html |date=October 13, 2013 }}</ref>
According to the latest statistics{{when|date=May 2016}} it has 23,000 members in 430 congregations served by 80 pastors.<ref name="auto"/> The president is Rev. J. Ronald Williams.<ref>[http://www.annibynwyr.org/aboutus/llywydd.html www.annibynwyr.org/aboutus/llywydd.html] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120729222520/http://www.annibynwyr.org/aboutus/llywydd.html |date=July 29, 2012 }}</ref>
== Interchurch relations == The Union is a member of the [[World Communion of Reformed Churches]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://wcrc.ch/wcrc-member-churches/ |title=Archived copy |accessdate=May 19, 2015 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140412134752/http://wcrc.ch/wcrc-member-churches/ |archivedate=April 12, 2014 }}</ref> Also a member in the [[International Congregational Fellowship]],<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.intercong.org/our-regions/northern-europe/|title=Jewelry Reviews|website=www.intercong.org}}</ref> [[Council for World Mission]]<ref>[http://www.cwmission.org/churches/europe-region/ www.cwmission.org/churches/europe-region/] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20131024190844/http://www.cwmission.org/churches/europe-region/ |date=October 24, 2013 }}</ref> and the [[World Council of Churches]].
It has friendly relations with the [[Congregational Federation]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.cfwales.org.uk/about.html|title=The Congregational Federation in Wales - what is it?|website=www.cfwales.org.uk}}</ref>

1202 Avenue P (boys' high school)
222 Ocean Parkway (girls' elementary school)
1768 Ocean Avenue (girls' high school) | faculty = | athletics = [[Basketball]], [[flag football]], [[softball]], [[ice hockey|hockey]] | colors = {{colorbox|#0806FC}} {{colorbox|#FFFFFF}} Blue and white | nickname = Stars | coordinates = {{coord|40.616366|-73.963921|display=inline,title|format=dms|type:edu}} | free_label1 = Status | free_text1 = [[501(c)(3)]] [[nonprofit organization]]"[https://apps.irs.gov/app/eos/pub78Search.do?ein1=&names=%22Yeshiva+Shaare+Torah+Inc.%22&city=&state=All...&country=US&deductibility=all&dispatchMethod=searchCharities&submitName=Search Yeshiva Shaare Torah Inc.]" ''Exempt Organizations Select Check''. [[Internal Revenue Service]]. Retrieved July 25, 2017. | free_label2 = [[Taxpayer Identification Number|Tax ID No.]] | free_text2 = 11-2613334 | website = {{URL|http://yeshivatshaaretorah.com/}} }} '''Yeshivat Shaare Torah''' (more popularly known as '''Shaare Torah''' or just '''Shaare''') is a [[501(c)(3)]] [[non-profit organization]] that operates five [[Sephardic Judaism|Sephardic]] private [[Jewish day school]] programs located in [[Brooklyn]], [[New York (state)|New York]], United States.{{cite web|title=Charity Navigator - IRS Data for Yeshivat Shaare Torah|url=https://www.charitynavigator.org/index.cfm?bay=search.irs&ein=112613334|website=Charity Navigator|accessdate=10 March 2017}} {{cite web | url =https://www.guidestar.org/profile/11-2613334| title =Yeshiva Shaare Torah Inc, Brooklyn, NY | last = | first = | date = | website =[[Guidestar]] | publisher = | access-date =March 9, 2017 | quote = }} It includes single-gender elementary schools and high schools for boys and girls. The boys' high school has 309 students{{cite web | url =http://www.greatschools.org/new-york/brooklyn/5942-Yeshiva-Shaare-Torah-Boys-High-School/ | title =Yeshiva Shaare Torah Boys High School | last = | first = | date =January 31, 2017 | website = GreatSchools| publisher = | access-date = March 10, 2017| quote = }} and the girls' high school has 120 students. {{cite web | url =http://www.greatschools.org/new-york/brooklyn/9009-Shaare-Torah-High-School-Girls/ | title =Shaare Torah High School - Girls | last = | first = | date = November 3, 2014| website =GreatSchools | publisher = | access-date = March 10, 2017| quote = }} The organization also operates a preschool program for 60 children.{{cite web | url =http://childcarecenter.us/provider_detail/yeshivat_shaare_torah_preschool_brooklyn_ny| title =Information for Yeshivat Shaare Torah Preschool, a Universal Pre-K Half Day in Brooklyn NY | last = | first = | date =2017 | website =ChildcareCenter.us | publisher = | access-date =March 10, 2017 | quote = }}{{cite web|title=Yeshivat Shaare Torah|url=http://insideschools.org/component/schools/school/8827|website=insideschools.org|accessdate=11 March 2017}} ==Teaching philosophy== Shaare Torah is affiliated philosophically with the [[Haredi Judaism|haredi]] branch of [[Orthodox Judaism]]. Its stated goal is "to promote and foster the development of a Ben Torah, a young [person] capable of actively and wholesomely interacting with his fellow Jews and citizens". ==Student demographics== Shaare Torah primarily caters to the [[Sephardic]] Jewish community of Brooklyn, but also has students from around the [[New York City metropolitan area|Tri-State area]]. ==After high school graduation== Graduates are encouraged to participate in year-long programs at [[yeshivot]] and seminaries in Israel. Afterwards, some continue their studies in similar institutions, while others enroll in university, or go straight into the workforce. Some of the most popular universities among Shaare alumni, such as [[Brooklyn College]] and [[Baruch College]], grant up to one year's worth of credit to students who study in Israel, allowing them to apply these credits to their undergraduate degree. ==History== In 2009, 34 students at the girl's elementary school were injured when a sidewalk grate collapsed during a graduation ceremony.{{cite news | last = | first = | title =VIDEO & PHOTOS: Grate Collapse At Yeshiva Shaarei Torah Girls School; 30 Injured | newspaper =The Yeshiva World | location = | pages = | language = | publisher = | date = | url =http://www.theyeshivaworld.com/news/general/34719/breaking-story-grate-collapse-at-yeshiva-shaarei-torah-girls-school.html | accessdate =March 9, 2017 }} The girl's elementary school has about 300 students.{{cite news | last =Chan | first =Sewell | | last2 =Farmer | first2 =Ann|title =34 Students at Jewish School in Brooklyn Are Hurt in Grate Collapse | newspaper =[[New York Times]]| location = | pages = | language = | publisher = | date =May 22, 2009 | url =https://mobile.nytimes.com/2009/05/23/nyregion/23grate.html?referer=https://www.google.com/ | accessdate =March 9, 2017 }} That same year, the school closed due to the [[2009 flu pandemic in the United States|swine flu epidemic]].{{cite news | last = | first = | title =EXCLUSIVE BREAKING NEWS: Yeshiva Shaarei Torah Closed Due To Swine Flu| newspaper =The Yeshiva World | location = | pages = | language = | publisher = | date =May 24, 2009 | url =http://www.theyeshivaworld.com/news/general/34768/exclusive-breaking-news-yeshiva-shaarei-torah-closed-due-to-swine-flu.html | accessdate =March 9, 2017 }} In 2015, the school hosted a political rally promoting tax credits for parents of children in private schools.{{cite news | last = | first = | title =VIDEO AND PHOTOS: Governor Cuomo Visits Yeshiva Shaare Torah In Flatbush To Discuss His ‘Parental Choice in Education Act’ [UPDATED] | newspaper =The Yeshiva World | location = | pages = | language = | publisher = | date =May 17, 2015 | url =http://www.theyeshivaworld.com/news/headlines-breaking-stories/311873/photos-governor-cuomo-visits-yeshiva-shaare-torah-in-flatbush-to-discuss-his-parental-choice-in-education-act.html | accessdate = }} [[New York Governor]] [[Andrew Cuomo]] spoke at the event, as did City Council Member [[David G. Greenfield]].{{cite news | last =Kaplan | first =Thomas | title =Cuomo Promotes Tax Credits for Families of Students at Private Schools | newspaper =[[New York Times]] | location = | pages = | language = | publisher = | date =May 17, 2015 | url =https://mobile.nytimes.com/2015/05/18/nyregion/cuomo-promotes-tax-credits-for-families-of-students-at-private-schools.html?referer=https://www.google.com/ | accessdate =March 9, 2017 }} ==Athletics== The boy's high school has athletic teams competing in [[softball]], [[basketball]], and [[flag football]]. The school is a member of the [[Metropolitan Yeshiva High School Athletic League]].{{cite web | url =http://mobile.myhsal.com/Teams/boys-v-softball/SHAARE| title = Boys V Softball: Shaare T| last = | first = | date =2017 | website =Metropolitan Yeshiva High School Athletic League | publisher = | access-date =March 10, 2017 | quote = }} ==Leadership== The [[Rosh Yeshiva]] of Shaare Torah is Rabbi Hillel Haber, a [[Syrian Jewish communities of the United States|Syrian Jew raised in Brooklyn]]. Rabbi Haber had moved to [[Israel]] to learn for 14 years in Yeshivat Kol Torah to further his study of Torah, but he returned to Brooklyn to found Shaare Torah. ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== * {{official web site|http://shaaretorahbhs.tripod.com/}} {{Boys' schools in New York City}} {{Girls' schools in New York City}} [[Category:Private elementary schools in Brooklyn]] [[Category:Private middle schools in Brooklyn]] [[Category:Private high schools in Brooklyn]] [[Category:Jewish education]] [[Category:Jews and Judaism in Brooklyn]] [[Category:Jewish day schools in New York (state)]] [[Category:Sephardi Jewish culture in New York City]] [[Category:Syrian-American culture in New York City]] [[Category:Syrian-Jewish culture in New York (state)]] [[Category:Boys' schools in New York (state)]] [[Category:Girls' schools in New York (state)]]
